personalInfo.name: Karam Matar
personalInfo.title: Software Engineer
personalInfo.bio: Software engineering student with experience in full-stack development, systems programming, and game development. I build compilers, practical tools, modern web apps, and game projects with a focus on clean code and maintainability.

paragraphs: Hello! I'm Karam Matar, a software engineer and game developer based in Sweden. I'm currently completing my B.Sc. in Software Engineering at Blekinge Institute of Technology, with an exchange semester at Newcastle University under my belt.

My journey in tech began with a fascination for how games were built, which evolved into a deep appreciation for software engineering as a whole. Today, I work across the full stack — from building compilers and systems-level tools to crafting modern web apps and game projects.

I'm currently interning at Softhouse as a software developer, where I serve as communication responsible in a cross-functional team. I believe in writing clean, maintainable code and building software that makes a real impact.

contactContent.sectionDescription: I'm always open to discussing new projects, creative ideas, or opportunities to be part of something amazing. Feel free to reach out!
contactContent.ctaDescription: Whether you have a question or just want to say hi, I'll try my best to get back to you as soon as possible!

skillsContent.learningTitle: Always learning and exploring new technologies. Currently interested in:

footerContent.tagline: Software Engineer focused on systems, compilers, and full-stack development

description: Acting as communication responsible within a cross-functional development team of 10–11 full-stack developers
Serving as the primary interface between the development team, the customer, and the Head of Department
Contributing in a task-based, full-stack workflow with shared ownership and rotating roles across sprints
Participating in requirements clarification, implementation, and code reviews within an agile development process

experiences.location: Remote via Blekinge Institute of Technology, Sweden
description: Developed an Azure DevOps pipeline task to detect third-party dependency vulnerabilities across repositories
Automated SBOM generation (JSON) to improve dependency transparency and compliance
Collaborated with stakeholders to align the solution with security and CI/CD requirements
Assisted students with debugging and optimization in C++, strengthening OOP understanding
Provided one-on-one mentorship on logic issues and memory management bugs

details: Relevant coursework: Compiler Design, Operating Systems, Algorithms & Data Structures, Linear Algebra
Relevant coursework: Computer Vision & AI, Algorithm Design and Analysis, Security Programming, Game Design

projects.title: Compiler from Scratch
projects.description: End-to-end compiler including lexer, parser, semantic analysis, CFG-based IR, TAC generation, and a custom virtual machine
projects.longDescription: Built an end-to-end compiler in C++ implementing lexical analysis, parsing, semantic analysis, control-flow graph based intermediate representation, three-address code generation, and a custom virtual machine for execution.

projects.title: VulnerabilityChecker 2.0
projects.description: Azure DevOps task that scans repositories for vulnerabilities in third-party packages
projects.longDescription: An Azure DevOps pipeline task that detects third-party dependency vulnerabilities across repositories and generates an SBOM (JSON) for improved dependency transparency and compliance.

projects.title: GyaGame
projects.description: 2D semi-open-world shooter game built in Java using a provided graphics library
projects.longDescription: A Java game project featuring core gameplay systems such as movement, shooting, and game logic, built using a provided graphics library.

projects.title: ShowcaseSERL
projects.description: Next.js web app for showcasing projects with dynamic listings, detailed views, and kiosk mode
projects.longDescription: A Next.js web app for showcasing projects with dynamic listings, detailed views, and kiosk mode support, built with a modern UI and responsive design.

projects.title: Space Invaders
projects.description: Space Invaders clone built in C++ using SFML
projects.longDescription: A Space Invaders clone built in C++ using SFML, focusing on core game loop, input handling, collision logic, and classic arcade gameplay.

projects.title: Death Marching Souls
projects.description: 3D Unity game featuring traversal, progression, and boss combat
projects.longDescription: A 3D Unity game featuring traversal, progression, and boss combat, built to practice gameplay systems and game design implementation in Unity.

seo.title: Karam Matar | Software Engineer & Game Developer
seo.description: Karam Matar is a software engineering student and developer focused on full-stack development, DevOps automation, and game development. Explore projects like VulnerabilityChecker 2.0, ShowcaseSERL, Space Invaders, and more.
